Question: Eurymedon the hierophant denounced this person for not holding the gods in honor.
Hints: In addition, this person disagreed with Plato about the location of universals.
Then **** proceeds and concludes that the actuality is prior to potentiality in formula, in time and in substantiality.
According to this person, spontaneity and chance are causes of some things, distinguishable from other types of cause.
